metadata.description: Complete list of all Text-to-Video and Image-to-Video models available in WildMind AI with their capabilities, parameters, and supported features

textToVideo.name: Text-to-Video (T2V)
textToVideo.useCase: Create new videos from scratch using text descriptions

imageToVideo.name: Image-to-Video (I2V)
imageToVideo.description: Animate or transform existing images into videos using text prompts
imageToVideo.useCase: Bring static images to life with motion and animation

videoToVideo.name: Video-to-Video (V2V)
videoToVideo.description: Transform or modify existing videos using text prompts
videoToVideo.useCase: Edit, enhance, or transform existing videos with AI

durationControl.name: Duration Control
durationControl.description: Control the length of generated videos (seconds)
durationControl.useCase: Create videos of specific lengths for different platforms

resolutionControl.name: Resolution Control
resolutionControl.description: Select specific resolution for video output
resolutionControl.useCase: Optimize video quality and file size based on intended use

aspectRatioControl.name: Aspect Ratio Control
aspectRatioControl.description: Control the width-to-height ratio of generated videos
aspectRatioControl.useCase: Create videos optimized for specific platforms (YouTube, Instagram, TikTok, etc.)

stitching.name: Video Stitching
stitching.description: Combine multiple video segments into longer videos
stitching.useCase: Create long-form videos by connecting multiple shorter segments

temporalControl.name: Temporal Control
temporalControl.description: Control input and output duration limits
temporalControl.useCase: Manage video length and input constraints

turboMode.name: Turbo/Fast Generation
turboMode.description: Faster video generation with reduced wait times

qualityTiers.name: Quality Tiers
qualityTiers.description: Different quality levels from fast to cinematic
qualityTiers.useCase: Match quality to project requirements and budget

multimodal.name: Multimodal Support
multimodal.description: Support for multiple input types (text, image, video, audio)
multimodal.useCase: Combine different media types for richer video generation

firstLastFrame.name: First-Last Frame Mode
firstLastFrame.description: Generate videos using two reference images (first frame and last frame) for better consistency and smoother transitions between segments
firstLastFrame.useCase: Create long-form videos with consistent transitions by using start and end frames for each segment
firstLastFrame.howItWorks: For each video segment, the system generates 2 images (first frame and last frame). The video model uses both frames to create a smooth transition. For sequential segments, the last frame of one video becomes the first frame of the next, ensuring seamless continuity.
firstLastFrame.framePattern: For N segments, generates N+1 images (e.g., 5 segments = 6 images). Video 1 uses Image 1 + Image 2, Video 2 uses Image 2 + Image 3, etc.

firstLastFrameDetails.description: Supports first-last frame mode for better segment consistency
Supports first-last frame mode for better segment consistency
firstLastFrameDetails.note: Works with 4, 6, and 8 second durations for image-to-video

supports.description: Supports Text-to-Video (T2V) and Image-to-Video (I2V), requires image input
Supports Text-to-Video (T2V) and Image-to-Video (I2V), requires image input
Text-to-Video (T2V) only with enhanced camera control

firstLastFrameModels.name: Veo 3.1
firstLastFrameModels.description: Default model with first-last frame support. Uses 2 images per video segment (first frame + last frame) for better consistency. Supports 4, 6, 8 second durations.
firstLastFrameModels.bestFor: Long-form videos requiring smooth transitions between segments

firstLastFrameModels.name: Veo 3.1 Fast
firstLastFrameModels.description: Fast variant with first-last frame support. Uses 2 images per video segment for consistency. Supports 4, 6, 8 second durations for image-to-video.
firstLastFrameModels.bestFor: Long-form videos with faster generation times

textToVideoModels.name: Sora 2 Pro
textToVideoModels.description: High-quality T2V model with up to 20 seconds duration, realistic motion

textToVideoModels.name: Veo 3.1
textToVideoModels.description: Default model supporting T2V, I2V, and V2V with cinematic quality

textToVideoModels.name: Veo 3.1 Fast
textToVideoModels.description: Fast variant supporting T2V and I2V, up to 8 seconds

textToVideoModels.name: Kling 2.5 Turbo Pro
textToVideoModels.description: Fast T2V model with 5-second duration, excellent motion

textToVideoModels.name: PixVerse v5
textToVideoModels.description: T2V model with multiple resolution options (360p to 1080p)

textToVideoModels.name: LTX V2 Pro
textToVideoModels.description: High-res T2V model supporting up to 4K (2160p) resolution

textToVideoModels.name: WAN 2.5
textToVideoModels.description: T2V model requiring image input, 5-second duration

textToVideoModels.name: WAN 2.5 Fast
textToVideoModels.description: Fast variant requiring image input, 5-second duration

textToVideoModels.name: MiniMax-Hailuo-02
textToVideoModels.description: T2V model with 6-second duration, 768P and 1080P support

textToVideoModels.name: T2V-01-Director
textToVideoModels.description: T2V model with enhanced camera control and director mode

imageToVideoModels.name: Veo 3.1
imageToVideoModels.description: Supports I2V with 4, 6, 8 second durations, cinematic quality

imageToVideoModels.name: Veo 3.1 Fast
imageToVideoModels.description: Fast I2V variant with 4, 6, 8 second durations

imageToVideoModels.name: Seedance 1.0 Pro
imageToVideoModels.description: I2V model with 2-12 second duration range, character consistency

imageToVideoModels.name: Seedance 1.0 Lite
imageToVideoModels.description: Fast I2V variant with 2-12 second duration range

videoToVideoModels.name: Veo 3.1
videoToVideoModels.description: Supports V2V transformation with cinematic quality

fieldDescriptions.id: Unique identifier for the model (used in API calls)
fieldDescriptions.name: Display name of the model
fieldDescriptions.inputType: Primary input type required (text, image, video, audio, none)
fieldDescriptions.outputType: Type of content produced (image, video, audio, text)

supports.textToContent: Whether the model supports Text-to-Video generation
supports.contentToContent: Whether the model supports Image-to-Video or Video-to-Video transformation
supports.multimodal: Whether the model supports multiple input types simultaneously

fieldDescriptions.maxBatch: Maximum number of videos that can be generated in a single batch request
fieldDescriptions.isDefault: Whether this model is set as default for new users
fieldDescriptions.isHighRes: Whether this model supports high-resolution output
fieldDescriptions.isTurbo: Whether this is a fast/turbo variant of the model
fieldDescriptions.contextWindow: Maximum input context length (in seconds for video models)

temporal.maxInputSeconds: Maximum duration of input video/content (if applicable)
temporal.stitchable: Whether multiple segments can be stitched together for longer videos
temporal.supportedDurations: List of specific duration values supported (in seconds)

fieldDescriptions.strengths: Array of keywords describing the model's strengths (e.g., 'fast', 'realistic', 'motion')
fieldDescriptions.textToVideo: Boolean indicating if this model supports Text-to-Video generation
fieldDescriptions.imageToVideo: Boolean indicating if this model supports Image-to-Video transformation
fieldDescriptions.videoToVideo: Boolean indicating if this model supports Video-to-Video transformation
fieldDescriptions.firstLastFrame: Boolean indicating if this model supports First-Last Frame mode (using 2 reference images per video segment)

firstLastFrameDetails.supported: Whether first-last frame mode is supported
firstLastFrameDetails.consistencyScore: Consistency score (1-10) indicating how well the model maintains consistency
firstLastFrameDetails.supportedDurations: List of durations supported in first-last frame mode
firstLastFrameDetails.recommendedFor: Use cases where this mode is recommended
firstLastFrameDetails.note: Additional notes about first-last frame support

contracts.accepts: List of input types the model accepts
contracts.produces: List of output types the model produces
